subject: Philosophy
title: Impermanence
description: A micro-lesson that makes Impermanence usable.

hook.text: A mother carried her dead child to the Buddha, begging him to bring it back to life.

buildup.text: He told her to bring a mustard seed from a house where no one had ever died. She searched and searched.

discovery.text: Every house had known death. She understood: impermanence isn't a tragedy. It's the nature of things.

twist.text: We suffer not because things change, but because we pretend they won't.

climax.text: Accepting impermanence doesn't bring sadness. It deepens appreciation for what's here right now.

punchline.text: Nothing lasts. That's what makes it beautiful.

quiz.question: What lesson did the mustard seed story teach?
